'3-Hydroxypropionic acid' is a carboxylic acid, specifically a beta hydroxy
acid. It is an acidic viscous liquid with a pKa of 4.5. It is
very soluble in water, soluble in ethanol, and miscible with diethyl ether. Upon
distillation, it dehydrates to form acrylic acid.

3-Hydroxypropionic acid is used in the industrial production of various
chemicals such as acrylates. It can be produced by certain
microbes. [http://bio.org/ind/presentations/AdhesivesSealants.pdf The
Biobased Revolution]
headings: Applications in producing a biodegradable polymer
